**Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters**

**Scripture Title:** *Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters*
Four fascicles by Wang Xuanhe of the Tang.
Source edition: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Unity*, Supreme Peace Section.

**Fascicle One of *Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters***

**Chapter on Immortal Abodes** (also called *Daoist Precincts*, *Mystic Altars*, *Refinement Halls*, or *Jinghai*)

The *Scripture of Original Forms* states: During the Dragon Han era, the Heavenly Worthy refined the true script within the Seven Treasures Hall of the Northern Ridge’s Mystic Mound, where the celestial radiance of the Great Primordial inscribed the hall’s four sides.

The *Three Caverns Regulations* states: The establishment of *jing* halls and palace chambers follows the precept of "tranquility and governance," cultivating Heavenly Virtue. Heavenly Virtue refers to the earth of *jia*, *yi*, *bing*, and *ding*. For lay households, it is called *jing*; for masters’ abodes, it is called *zhi*. All measure one *zhang* and eight *chi* in length and one *zhang* and six *chi* in width. Those who bear the talismans and registers of the immortals and spirits must establish *jing* and *zhi*.

The *Dharma Wheel Scripture* states: Upon beholding terraces and halls, one’s thoughts become boundless, gazing universally across the eight directions. Body and spirit unite, penetrating the subtle and obscure. Now, *guan* (observation) means to gaze, to observe the eight directions. The eight directions are the eight cardinal points. If one can settle the spirit and stabilize the will, one will penetrate the wondrous and subtle, seeing clearly into the obscure and profound. The obscure and profound, the wondrous and subtle, are the ultimate fruit of the Great Profound and True Unity. Thus, the *Five Thousand Character Upper Scripture* states: "Ever desireless, one observes its mystery; ever desiring, one observes its subtlety." In the present text, the character *wei* (subtle) is mistakenly written as *hui* (emblem), a case of graphic similarity leading to a long-standing scribal error.

The *Upper Clarity Scripture of Transformations* states: The Western Terrace Hall is where the Two Perfected partake of service and where records are inscribed. It also speaks of the Nine Mysteries Hall, the Great Ultimate Abode (where the Upper Clarity’s supreme perfected undergo transformation), and the Purple Supreme Abode (wherein the secret true script of the Great Numinous is concealed).

The *Upper Clarity Scripture* states: The Harmonious Dawn Numinous Abode is where the Jade Dawn Dao Lord resides.

The *Declarations of the Perfected* states: The Hall of Shifting Changes is where the Lady of Harmonious Dawn dwells.

The *Scripture of the Three Primes’ Distribution* states: The Heavenly King of Primordial Beginning, at the Radiant Rosy Clouds Abode, commanded the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens to descend and bestow the jade tablets upon the Upper Perfected.

The *Numinous Writ Scripture* states: In the northern realm of Yüdan, there is the Cavern Numinous Hall, its height matching the clouds. Its interior is dark and lightless, its four sides devoid of illumination. Yet another Cavern Numinous Hall exists, luminous and manifest, its four sides transparent as the radiance of the sun at midday. The Heavenly Worthy sealed the celestial script within this hall, hence its name, the Cavern Numinous Hall. It also states: At times, the Supreme Dao Lord, in the Southern Cinnabar Cavern Yang’s Upper Hall of Cypress Mound, bowed in reverence to inquire of the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning, who expounded the *Upper Scripture on the Roots of Transgressions*.

The *Hidden Words of the Numinous Treasure* states: "In the Northern Numinous Hall of Conjoined Radiance, we soar hand in hand above the clouds." It also states: The Heaven of Constant Fusion possesses the Purple Tenuity Hall, situated above the Jade Clarity, resplendent within the Purple Void. It further states: "Passing through the courtyard of the Three Realms, one ascends into the Hall of the Great Numinous."

The *Scripture of the Supreme Lord’s Flight* states: The Dao Lord roams the Feathered Shade Hall, resting at the Gate of the Cavernous Vastness.

The *Scripture of the Eight Festivals’ Atonement* states: On the days of the eight solar terms, the Supreme Emperor of the August Prime ascends to the Upper Clarity’s Moonlit Cold realm, the numinous dwelling of the Great Void’s palace, the Cinnabar-Purple Terrace, the everlasting Jade Towers. The host of immortals gathers at the Great Tenuity Abode to deliberate and determine the karmic fortunes of the world’s myriad people.

The *Transmissions of Daoist Learning* states: Wu Meng, styled Shiyun, in his mountain-climbing poem, wrote: "Gazing upward at the arrayed immortals’ halls, looking down upon the jade spirits’ dwellings." It also states: Xu Yufu’s great-grandson, Lingzhen, during the Liang dynasty, was by imperial decree established at Mao Mountain’s Successive Perfected Hall to honor his distant ancestor’s virtue. Tao Hongjing’s residence, the Vermilion Yang Hall, was the former abode of the Senior Scribe Xu. It further states: Kong Lingchan, styled Yanling, a native of Shanyin in Kuaiji, delved deeply into the essentials of the Dao and perused the entire corpus of immortal texts. Emperor Ming of the Song established the Cherishing Immortals Hall beside the Yu Cavern and decreed that he reside there. It also states: Emperor Gao of Chen delivered lectures at the Righteous Immortals Hall. Xiao Ziyi of Lanling, styled Qianhua, rose from his seat clad in coarse cloth and donated his woven silk scripture scarf to serve as an offering. After Ziyi’s passing, the ritual implements and scriptures were all absorbed into the public treasury, and the scarf from the Abbey of Peace remains preserved to this day. It also states: Emperor Wu of Liang established the Great Clarity Hall on Mount Tianmu, inviting all Daoist communities to gather and rest there.

The *Great Cavern Scripture* states: On Mount Yuan Gui, there is the Nine Numinous Jade Hall, the dwelling of the Supreme Thearch’s Jade Consort.

The *Scripture of Original Forms* states: In the land of Gaoyang, there is the Hall of Eternal Joy, twelve *chi* square. Its exterior and interior are entirely inscribed with the celestial radiance of the Great Primordial script, inscribed on all four sides to protect this hall.

The *Scripture of the August Person’s Guarding the Three Ones* states: The August Person of Mount Emei constructed a house of azure jade, with legs shaped like yellow gold, and walls of five colors.

The *Concealed Instructions for Ascending Perfection* states: Yan Kou Mountain, also called the Square Source Hall, is where Emperor Xiaoming once compounded the divine elixir and ascended to the Mystic Continent. It also states: The ancients once compounded the Nine-Cauldron Elixir here.

The *Record of the Ten Continents* states: On Yingzhou, there is the Golden Turret Abode, adorned with myriad jades, its peak piercing the clouds. Within stands a dark-azure jade table, draped with a canopy of cloud-woven silk. Water-green jade is carved into inverted dragons, fire essence forms the sun, and black jade is carved into crows. Water essence forms the moon, and various jades compose the toad and hare. Beneath the ground lies a mechanism that ensures the waxing and waning of the moon remain unerring. Fragrant winds arrive cool and refreshing; to receive them with outstretched sleeves is to remain sated for ages without weariness.

The *Upper Scripture of the Phoenix Terrace and Pure Silk* states: "The moon shines upon the Western Flower Hall, its intent harmonizing with the Moonlit Cold Palace."

Amidst the dancing purple phoenix’s descent,
the Nine Ridges’ peaks stand desolate.
Gazing afar, the boundless wilds stretch endlessly;
looking upward, one beholds the kalpas’ edge.

The *Purple Dawn Scripture of the Supreme Sovereign Master* states:
Golden Lads ascend clouds to attend the Wheel,
Jade Maidens tread the void to guard the Divine.

Eastward lies the Azure Waters’ Hall,
the Abyssal Cavern’s numinous vastness,
the source of utmost purity.

The *Concealed Instructions on Ascending Perfection* states:
On the western side of Great Mount Mao stand the Upper and Lower Hua-Yang Halls.
It further states: Beneath Square Mountain lies the Secluded Chamber, where many Dao-seeking practitioners reside.
And: King Jing of Song established a hall, with Wang Wenqing as its master.

The *Orthodox Methods of the Three Heavens* states:
The Pure Tenuity Hall, wherein the Hymns of the Three Heavens emerged.

The *Hidden Writ of the Eight Arts and Divine Tiger* states:
The Hall of the Supreme Perfected, where the Celestial Lord of the Grand Tenuity received the Golden Talisman of the Wisdom-Endowing Divine Tiger for vanquishing demons.

The *True Formula of the Three-Nine Plain Words and Jade Essence* states:
The Lofty Jade Hall, wherein the *Three-Nine Plain Words* are concealed.

The *Seven Sages’ Mysterious Chronicle of the Jade Emperor* states:
The Scenic Radiance Abbey, where the Lord Emperor resides.
It further states: The Purple Void Jade Hall, where the August Personages convene.

The *Scripture on the Three Daoist Sequences* states:
The Purple Radiance Inner Contemplation, wherein the *Eight Plain True Scripture* resides.

The *Jade Radiance Eight Effulgences Scripture* states:
The Jade Void Abbey, where the Most High Dao Lord returns to quiescence.

The *True Formula of Jade Essence* states:
The Lofty Jade Hall lies in the Purple Void Heaven, wherein the *Three-Nine Plain Words: True Formula of Jade Essence* is sealed.

The *Lower Scripture of the Great Cavern Perfected Writ* states:
The Sky-Mirroring Cavern Abbey, wherein the Golden Perfected and Jade Scripture reside.

The *Lower Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:
The Dao Lord ascends the Azure Waters’ Void Terrace Abbey and the Azure Isle’s Purple Hall.

The *Orthodox Methods of the Three Heavens* states:
The Nine Mysteries Emperor Lord sings:
*"Weave the awn of the Great Radiance Hall,
gaze afar to boundless kalpas."*

The Azure Lad also sings:
*"The fragrant savor of the Upper Clarity Hall—
how could one sense lingering stagnation?"*

The *Scripture of Great Possession’s Wonders* states:
*"Dragons chant in the Silk Mansion,
phoenixes cry in the Grand Empyrean Hall."*

The *Commentary on the Jade Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:
The Emperor Lord rides the Cinnabar Empyrean to initiate the Dao.
The Grand Obscurity dons green radiance to illumine subtleties,
resplendent in the Golden Pond’s Hall.

It further states:
The Golden Alchemist Hall lies within the Jade Clarity Heaven, where the Supreme Sovereign Perfected governs.
And: Atop Kunlun Mountain stands the Nine Numinous Hall,
above linked to the Turning Mechanism’s Wheel,
below situated within the Grand Chamber,
where the Queen Mother of the West presides.

The *Original Register of Mount Tortoise* states:
*"Ascending the Five Ridges’ peaks,
flocks soar to the Grand Hua Abbey."*

The *Upper Scripture of the Seven Cycles of the Purple Dawn Lord* states:
The Supreme Sovereign Master nurtures spirit at the Divine Continent’s Gate,
in the desolate boundless Hall.

The *Eight Effulgences Flying Scripture of the Upper Clarity* states:
The Most High Great Dao Lord, aloof atop the Grand Tortoise,
roams beyond boundlessness,
each returning to the Jade Void’s Hall.

The *Authentic Declarations* states:
The Paulownia-Cypress Perfected sings:
*"Inscribe me in the Golden Court Hall,
unharness my carriage at the Three Flowers’ precincts.
Night Mushrooms drape the Flowery Peak;
chewing them, one knows no lasting hunger."*

The *Authentic Declarations* further states:
*"I traverse the Three Marvels’ Abbey,
floating effulgences transcend soaring obscurity."*

And:
*"Lush and dense, yet not the true void—
the Grand Nothingness is my hall."*

And:
*"Purple Gates rise into the void above,
the Dark Hall pierces the raging gale."*

And:
*"Shaded and lush, the Purple Tenuity Hall,
the Terrace of Luxuriance scatters radiant winds."*

And:
*"Receiving essence from the Dark Han,
I thus transform my countenance in the Three Yin’s Hall."*

The *Scripture of Ascending Mystery* states:
There is the Floating Cloud Abbey, where the Heavenly Worthy roams.

The *Perfected Writ of the Great Cavern* states:
In the Forest of Luminosity stands the Hall of the Central Yellow Supreme Unity Emperor, wherein the Primordial Lad resides.

The *Hidden Formula of the Dragon-Flight Silk Text* states:
The Perfected Venerable roams the Purple Void’s Hall.
It further states:
*"The Fragrant Mist of the Grand Void Hall,
divine winds disperse rare fragrances."*

And:
Bo Chengzi, Gu Xizi, Guang Chengzi, and Qing Zhenzi
roam the Three Plain Eight Wheels’ wondrous abbeys.

The *White Feather Black Quill Scripture* states:
The Perfected Venerable wanders the Purple Void’s Hall,
resting his carriage at the boundless edge.

It further states:
The Perfected Venerable
journeys north to the Dark Mystery Hall of the Northern Darkness,
the Frigid Waters’ land.

The *Scripture of Upper Clarity’s Transformations* states:
The Southern Culmen’s Longevity Life-Commanding Lord
roams the Golden Cavern’s Plain Numinous Hall,
encountering the Nine Numinous Golden Mother.
The Grand Plain Three Origin Lords
receive the *Original Register of Mount Tortoise*.
Ascending the Supreme Unity Emperor’s Hall,
they obtain the *Grand Empyrean Alchemist Writ*.
Further: The August Sovereign refines purple stone in the Cinnabar Numinous,
engraving records in the Western Terrace’s Hall,
establishing rites in the Eastern Florescence’s direction,
harmonizing transformations with the Three Plain’s qi,
gazing upward to partake of the Dawn Ascent’s radiance.

The *Upper Scripture of Flying Feather Arts* states:
The Most High Dao Lord
once roamed the Northern Heaven,
urging his carriage to the Broad Cold,
treading the Florid Canopy,
pushing aside the Nine Origins,
soaring through the Cloud Palace,
playing in the Northern Mystery,
resting at the Cavern’s Gate and the Feathered Darkness’ Hall,
glancing at the Turning Mechanism to summon motion,
hastening the kalpa’s convergence to dance the Wheel,
sighing for the myriad things’ decay,
gazing down upon heaven and earth’s enduring presence.

The *Seven Cycles and Seven Transformations Scripture of the Divine Continent* states:
The Purple Dawn Supreme Sovereign Master
nurtures spirit at the Divine Continent’s Gate,
in the desolate boundless Hall,
rectifying the Three and Five’s revolutions,
rescuing transformations from Tang’s calamities.

It further states:
The Bright Beam’s Hall transforms white into azure.
And:
The Vast Cinnabar Empyrean Abbey,
where profound solitude reveals the dark kalpa’s workings.
And:
Ascending the Nine Empyreans’ Hall,
soaring to the Jade Clarity Palace.
And:
The Lofty One solemnly mounts the Dragon Carriage,
feasting in the Purple Empyrean’s Hall.

The *Jade Pendant and Golden Earrings Upper Scripture* states:
The Supreme Lord’s Hidden Mystery Treasure Chapters reside within the Jade Clarity Abbey.
It further states:
The Upper Clarity’s Yin Radiance Inner True Scripture dwells in the Upper Clarity Abbey, amid the Great Empyrean.

The *Great Empyrean Purple Book* states:
At dawn, I wander the Western Terrace Abbey; at dusk, I rest in the Fusang Palace.
It further states:
The Vast and Boundless Purple Void Abbey, where auspicious clouds dissolve with transformation.
And:
Holding the tally in the Great Empyrean Abbey, returning to the true and mysterious compositions.

The *Sutra of Foreign Liberated Beings* states:
The Azure Youth Lord roams freely in the Purple Void Abbey.

The *Upper Clarity Petition Rites* states:
Reclining in the Grand Constancy Abbey, ascending the towering Mother’s Court.

The *Empty Cavern Numinous Chapters* states:
The heavens possess void and brightness; the vast abbey of Brahman conduct,
where the Primordial Upright descends, and the Registrar of Destinies holds the reckoning tally.

The *Scripture of Ascending the Mystery* states:
The Supreme Lord governs within Kunlun’s central realm,
then ascends to the Celestial Summit’s Great Governance Seven Treasures Virtue-Power Abbey,
whereupon he declares to Celestial Master Zhang:
“My Dao emerged before the Nameless and the Great Beginning.”
It further states:
Though the body dwells in the tigers’ and leopards’ lair, the heart abides in the Abbey of Blessing and Virtue.

The *Cavern Mystery Scripture* states:
The Purple Tenuity Supreme Numinous Abbey, where the Brahman-Pervading Heaven’s inner sounds are inscribed above.
It further states:
The Fusang Controller of Numinous Abbey, where the Primordial Cavern Heaven’s inner sounds are inscribed above.
And:
The Northern Numinous Upper Abbey, where the Wengzhong Heaven’s inner sounds are inscribed above.
And:
The Northern Numinous Abbey, where the Seven Luminaries Heaven’s inner sounds are inscribed above.
And:
The Purple Yang Abbey, where the Wenju Heaven’s inner sounds are inscribed above.
And:
The Cavern Numinous Primordial Yang Abbey, located on the Jade Capital Mountain of the Great Mystery Metropolis,
where the Primordial Beginning, Numinous Treasure, Southern Heaven’s Great Sage Host of Perfected Honored Divinities,
the Boundless Dao’s Southern Supreme Crimson Emperor, Cinnabar Numinous Venerable Lord,
Grand Harmony Jade Maiden, Longevity Marshal Hao Sheng Jun,
Registrars of Destiny and Record, Southern Culmen Deliverance-from-the-World Lord, and Myriad Blessings Lord
regularly convene on the twenty-third day of each month to assemble and review the celestial and human allotments of fortune and lifespan.

The *Cavern Real Scripture* states:
The Golden Cavern Plain Numinous Abbey, where the Nine Numinous Metal Mother and Supreme Plain Three Primordial Lords reside.
It further states:
The Pure Tenuity Upper Abbey, where the Primordial Beginning Heavenly King dwells.
And:
The Jeweled Flower Sunwatch Abbey, where the Supreme and Lofty Jade Dawn Dao Lord resides.

The *Scripture of Dao Traces* states:
In the Moon Abbey, the Primordial Beginning Heavenly King summons and records the cries of the imperial subjects within.

The *Scripture of Five Refinements for Reviving the Corpse* states:
In former times, in the land of Shanren, there was a Daoist named Huang Xinran,
who attained the Dao and became the Primordial Numinous Venerable Lord,
with his Dao traces inscribed in the Southern Palace’s records at the Purple Tenuity Abbey.

The *Inner Sounds and Jade Characters Lower* states:
The Purple Tenuity Abbey stands above Jade Clarity, within which dwell the multitudes of Tuoqiu—
countless millions. The Tuoqiu are those newly delivered and receiving numinous empowerment,
whose merits remain incomplete, thus they abide scattered therein.
There is also the Supreme Numinous Abbey, where the Brahman-Pervading Heavenly King governs within.

The *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Great Cavern Jade Scripture* states:
Above the Nine Heavens stands the Golden Rampart Abbey, where the Jade Emperor resides.
It further states: Atop Mount Kunlun lies the Numinous Mushroom Abbey, its upper reaches connecting to the Turning Mechanism of the Celestial Sphere, its base suspended within the Great Void—this is the domain governed by the Queen Mother of the West.

The *Arrayed Records of the Latter Sage Dao Lord* states:
The Crimson Dawn Abbey of Vast Expanse, where the clear and distant workings of the Dark Mystery manifest.

The *Nine Yang Marvels of the Eight Simplicities* states:
The Vast Court of the Grand Tenuity Abbey, towering where the Nine Mysteries abide.
Within dwells the Wise One who upholds stillness, chanting in the tranquil depths of the Dark Mystery.
It further states: The Northern Asterism binds the Vermilion Abbey, standing in solemn array upon the Nine Void Peaks.
It further states: The Luminous Clarity Abbey of Dark Radiance, woven at the edge of the mistless horizon.
It further states: The Nameless Abbey of Cavernous Wandering, where the dragon’s retinue revolves the jade wheel.

The *Scripture of the Three Sovereigns* states:
The August Ultimate Abbey stands majestic, the resplendent Jade Grove Chambers.
It further states: Following the Tortoise Mountain Abbey, singing and chanting in the Fusang Grove.

Yin Xi’s *Original Record of the Abbey of Lofty Contemplation* states:
In former times, King Kang of Zhou, hearing that Master Yin possessed the grand aspiration of transcendence and immortality, appointed him as a grandee and named his residence the Abbey of Lofty Contemplation. Later, King Mu of Zhou expanded this abbey, summoning reclusive worthies to become Daoists and reside within. From then on, the tradition continued unbroken to this day.

The *Sacred Records of Lord Lao* states:
King Mu of Zhou also built an abbey for Du Chong, styled Xuanyi, of Haojing, appointing Chong as a Daoist within. Later, Chong attained the rank of Perfected One of the Supreme Ultimate.

Thus it is known that the establishment of abbeys among men began with King Kang of Zhou. The placement of Daoists within abbeys, however, originated with King Mu of Zhou. As for the name "Daoist," it first arose at the time of the initial separation of Heaven and Earth. The designation of "immortal abbey" predates even the division of Heaven and Earth, existing before the Four Heavens in the Great Luo Heaven. Above the Great Luo Heaven stands the Jade Capital Mountain, home to the Abbey of the Dark Metropolis.

The *Transmissions of Daoist Learning* states:
Emperor Wen of Liu Song established the Abbey of Revering the Void for Master Lu, with Liu Faxian as its director, bestowing upon him the title of National Preceptor. Dong Shuaifa, a native of Pengcheng, was later summoned by Emperor Ming of Liu Song to serve as its director.
It further states: In the fifteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, Emperor Wu built the Abbey of the Supreme Clarity and Dark Mystery for Tao Hongjing to unify and illuminate the teachings of the Dao.
It further states: Zhang Yunzhi, a native of Jiaxing in Wu Commandery, left home in his youth to follow masters and companions. After five years, he was imperially appointed as the director of the Abbey of Revering the Origin at the Southern Cavern of Mount Mao. Later, a separate site before the abbey was established as the Abbey of Jinling, where he secluded himself from worldly affairs to cultivate the supreme Dao.

Xue Biaozhi, a native of Jinling, during the reign of Emperor Gao of Qi, went to Mount Mao to build a hut, subsisting on pine seeds and stream water for many years. When Emperor Gao of Qi sought out reclusive Daoists during his revolution, learning that Biaozhi remained steadfast in the hills and valleys, unmoved by honor or rank, he imperially appointed him as the director of the Abbey of Jinling on that mountain.

Cheng Tongsun, styled Anren, was a native of Guoshan County in Yixing. Of profound and keen disposition, he stood alone and unyielding. In his youth, he left home, maintaining a long-term vegetarian diet. Near and far, all who met him deepened their faith. In the sixteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, he was imperially appointed as the senior seat of the Abbey of Tranquil Mind, where he governed the assembly with exemplary virtue and conduct.

Meng Zhizhou, a native of Jianye in Danyang, lectured at the Abbey of Revering the Void during the Liu Song dynasty, composing the *Repentance Text of the Ten Directions*.

Xue Biaozhi, a native of Jinling, in the second year of the Jianwu era of Qi, sojourned in the eastern lands to seek out true secrets. After three years, he returned and petitioned to establish the Abbey of the Grotto Heaven on the eastern ridge of Great Mount Mao.

Jiang Fuchu, a native of Yixing, came and went from Mount Mao, aspiring to dwell there. Emperor Gao of Qi built an abbey on the mountain, and in the second year of the Jianyuan era, he was imperially summoned to perform the Daoist rites at the Abbey of Zongyang. Fuchu later established the Abbey of Assisting Perfection at the former residence of Director Xu, where he attended to the toils of reception. He then entrusted the affairs of the abbey to his second son, Hongsu, to focus solely on cultivating the supreme methods.

Dongxiang Zongchao, styled Yilun, was a native of Qianzou in Gaomi. He donated his former residence to establish the Abbey of Aspiring to the Mystery. There, he wove vines into a hut, thatched it with mallow, and together with his disciples, labored with their own hands. Though unadorned, the abbey was swiftly completed. During the reign of Emperor Jianwen of Liang, when the Prince of Luling was stationed there, he grandly constructed halls and corridors, all resplendent and magnificent, with ritual implements of exquisite refinement. Yet the master’s dwelling remained a thatched hut, his attire unchanged, his curtains of woven leaves maintaining austerity. He always sat upon a single round, worn-out couch, its surface grooved by his knees, his straw hat and rush mat frayed and unaltered.

It further states: The Daoist Zhang Fameng established the Abbey of Stone Islet on the northern bank of the Yuan Pond’s rocky islet, inviting Jia Leng to lecture there for three years. The Liang emperor commanded Yan Jizhi to reside within, where all offerings of food and ritual feasts were vegetarian. (See the *Biography of Jia Leng*.)

In the early Liu Song dynasty, Prince Jing of Changsha built a Daoist retreat east of Director Xu’s residence. In the thirteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, it was imperially designated as the Abbey of Vermilion Yang. Emperor Ming of Liu Song summoned Master Lu Quan to reside at the Lodge of the Cavalry Barge, where guests and visitors were received with constant hospitality. Thus it is known that the term "retreat" is commonly used across the Three Teachings.

Yin Faren, styled Zidao, was a native of Yangxia in Chen Commandery. He left home in his youth, diligently reciting scriptures and maintaining a vegetarian diet. There was a Chen Wenhe, a wealthy man of the capital, who established the Abbey of Righteous Transcendence and invited Faren to reside there.

The Abbey of the Nine Perfected was the residence of Wang Lingyu, styled Shanbao, a native of Qu’a in Jinling, where he focused on cultivating the supreme Dao. He was imperially granted two hundred abbey laborers, along with gold, silk, incense, and medicines—all provided in abundance.

Xie Xuan, styled Yuanying, was a native of Yangxia in Chen Commandery.

He maintained a perpetual vegetarian diet, devoting himself entirely to cultivating the Dao. On Shangyu Mountain, he cleared away brambles to open a path and established a mountain abbey—an achievement that seemed like divine work.

Zhu Ding, styled Shu’an, was a native of Nan Sha in Xin Yi. Fond of the divine immortals, he entered Haiyu Mountain in his youth to study under Xie Xuan. Seeing his resolve, Xuan allowed him to reside at the Yuanyang Abbey, where he was tasked with safeguarding Master Zhu’s scriptures. Later, to the right of the Yuanchang Abbey, he established a separate retreat, cutting off all human traffic.

Lu Xiujing, styled Yuande, was a native of Dongqian in Wu Xing. At the foot of a waterfall on the southeast side of Mount Lu, he built an abbey named Jianji, a secluded and profound place with magnificent and extraordinary construction. Those who beheld it were filled with reverence, evoking visions of the Kunlun and Lang ranges. Later generations thus honored Xiujing with the title "Master of Simplicity and Tranquility."

Wang Sengzhen, a native of Jin Shou in Liang Zhou, established the Futang Abbey in An Lu of Pan Zhou. Passing through Ying Zhou on his return, he also built the Shenwang Abbey, both of which were exquisitely adorned. Additionally, he founded the Jiuzhen Abbey on Mount Heng. In Jing Zhou, there was the Shixing Abbey, where Yu Chengxian of Ying Zhou expounded the Daoist scriptures. Chu Boyu, styled Yuanqu, was a native of Qiantang in Wu Jun. He withdrew to the Waterfall Mountain of Mount Nan Heng, mastering esoteric arts and delving deeply into mystical diagrams and secrets. He practiced alchemical refinement and ingestion without exception. Emperor Gaozu of the Qi Dynasty summoned him with ceremonial gifts from the two commanderies of Wu and Kuaiji, but he declined on grounds of illness.

Shortly thereafter, Boyu passed away, and Emperor Gaozu mourned his loss. He then ordered the establishment of the Taiping Abbey at the foot of Waterfall Mountain. Boyu had been fond of studying the *Scripture of Great Peace* and practiced its Way, hence the name of the abbey.

Sun Yue, styled Xuanda, was a native of Yongkang in Dongyang. In the third year of Yongming during the Qi Dynasty, he was summoned by imperial decree to serve as the master of Xingshi Abbey. There, he diligently cultivated the supreme Way and earnestly guided disciples, with several hundred constantly receiving his teachings.

It is also said that during the Yongming era, Prefect Wang Liang and Magistrate Gu Hui of Jinling petitioned the court to construct a terrace in the outskirts, where they established the Qizhen Abbey for Li Jingyou, styled Huiguan, a native of Jinling. On the eve of its construction, they dreamed of King Yan of Yan, who presented twenty pillars to aid in building the Daoist sanctuary. Soon after, they arrived at a body of water within the city and saw rosewood pillars filling the water—once the required number was taken, they vanished. Popular lore holds that King Yan of Yan was a figure from the Warring States period.

Xu Mingye, a native of Chigang in Fufeng, left home in his youth and maintained a strict vegetarian diet. During the Taiqing era of the Liang Dynasty, he was invited by the Prince of Nanping, the provincial governor, to reside at the Shenwang Abbey north of the city. When turmoil arose, he retreated to Mount Qingxi in Wuchang, where he established an abbey, earning reverence from both near and far.

Yang Chao, styled Chaoyuan, was a native of Donghai. During the Liang Dynasty, he entered Mount Bao in Wu to serve as the master of Linwu Abbey, where his disciples numbered in the thousands. He also served as the master of Huayang Abbey and separately established the Zhaozhen Abbey to its east.

Feng Faxian, styled Fayuan, was a native of Qu’e in Jinling. During the Chen Dynasty, the Chongyuan Abbey was built on Mount Mao, its grandeur unmatched. The *Nine Chapters of the Eight Yang Plain Songs* state: "At dawn, one enters the lodge of the rare forest; at dusk, one feasts in the cinnabar chamber of subtle radiance." It further states: "The cavernous abode of the vast cold, where the numinous Dao shares its wondrous sameness." And: "The towering, jagged abode where heads align—no reckoning of form or name." And: "Crimson halls with phoenix-rafters, bright light illuminating the open pavilions."

The *Hidden Writ of the Two Luminaries’ Flight* states: "The Great Mystery Palace, the Lofty Supreme Terrace, and the Penglai Prefecture are all of golden pillars and jade walls."

The *Eleventh Scripture of the Original Form* states: "In the land of Fusang stands the Dharma Hall of the Primordial Beginning, its walls of white silver, its foundations of true pearls, its beams of yellow gold, its pillars of bronze, its rafters of the five jades, its roof of lapis lazuli, its steps of crystal, and its thresholds of coral."

It further states: "Northeast of the Dharma Hall lies the abode of Grand Harmony, where descendants dwell within, transmitting the lineage without end."

The twenty-first scroll states: "The immortal divine palace has nine tiers above and below, standing one hundred twenty *zhang* high, its base nine *chi* across, and its square perimeter one hundred twenty paces." It further mentions: "The sevenfold temple of divine immortals follows the pattern of the twenty-eight lunar lodges."

The *Scripture of the Seventy-Four Methods of Transformation* states: "The soaring dark beams of the cloudy heavens, the courtyard of divine transformations without trace."

The *Scripture of the Three Sovereigns* states: "Long abide in the lodge of the Great One, return to life and pay homage to the Three Honored Ones."

The *Third Scripture of the Original Form* states: "One beholds a celestial hall, its walls of lapis lazuli, its beams of yellow gold, its pillars of azure jade, and its roof of lapis lazuli." It further states: "One beholds a celestial hall, its walls of lapis lazuli, its beams of purple jade, its pillars of red jade, its roof of yellow gold, and its radiance flashing all around."

The *Ninth Scripture of the Original Form* states: "In the west lies the Great Hall Kingdom, within which stands the abode of Everlasting Joy, rising three hundred *zhang* high, its four sides inscribed with the celestial script of the Great Luminous Chaos."

The *Second Scroll of the Transmission of Daoist Learning* states: "Within the grotto chamber lie golden cities and jade houses, where the true writ resides." It further states: "On the four sides stand jade pillars, inscribed with the words: *The Ruins of the Nine Springs and the Grotto Court*."

The *Transmission of Daoist Learning* states: "Wu Meng, styled Shiyun, in his poem upon ascending the mountain, wrote: *Gazing up at the gallery of the ranked immortals, looking down upon the jade abode of the divine.*"

The *Transmission of Daoist Learning* further states: "The House of Myriad Streams is the dwelling of Xiang Tuo."

The *Inner Transmission of the Perfected of Pure Emptiness, Lord Wang* states: "Lord Wang could not relinquish worldly attachments to ascend the nine heavens, so he built the mound of the Great Void and paid homage at the Jade Emperor’s lodge."

The *Golden Chapters of Inner Perfection* states: "Those who often recite the verses of the *Plain Songs* in the quietude of their chambers shall be guests of the Five Elders."

The *Fourth Scripture of the Original Form* states: "The abode of Everlasting Joy is one *zhang* square, its exterior and interior inscribed entirely with the celestial script of the Great Luminous Chaos."

The *Scripture of the Numinous Writ* states: "The neighboring abode lies in the Kingdom of Great Blessing, where the Heavenly Worthy expounded the true writ of the Numinous Treasure to deliver the Dharma and save people."

The *Scripture of Original Conduct* states: "Deliverance and illumination occur on the Yang Hill’s peak, in the upper lodge of Cinnabar Mound, amidst the cypress grove, where red phoenixes attend and divine dragons flank the carriage."

The *Scripture of the Five Talismans* states: "Within the grotto chamber of Mount Bao lies a golden city, its jade houses and cloudy halls towering to the heavens."

Here ends the fourth scroll of *Matters and Forms of the Upper Clarity Dao*.

chunks.original_text: 上清道类事相 经名：上清道类事相。 唐王悬四卷。 底本出处：《正统道藏》太平部。 上清道类事相卷之一 仙观品亦曰道场亦曰玄坛亦日精舍亦曰靖海。 《本相经》云：天尊以龙汉之时，於北陇玄丘七宝馆内炼其真文，天景大混题馆四面也。 《三洞科》云：起靖馆宫堂，乃引律日安靖，治於天德。 天德者，甲乙丙丁地也。 民家曰靖，师家曰治，皆长一丈八尺，广一丈六尺。 凡佩仙灵符录，皆须安靖治也。 《法轮经》云：若见台馆，思念无量，普瞻八极，身与我神，洞见幽微。 今谓观则瞻，观八极。 八极者，八方也。 人若能安神定志，则通彻微妙，洞见幽玄。 幽玄与微妙者，太玄真一之极果也。 故五千文上经云：常无欲观其妙，常有欲观其微也。 今经本微字错作徽，此则字之相类，传写之误，其来日久矣。 《上清变化经》云：西台之馆，二真服御之处，刻录之所。 又云：九玄之馆。 又云：太极观，上元上真变化处也。 又云：紫上观，太灵真文秘在其中。 《上清经》云：协晨灵观，玉晨道君居之。 《真诰》云：易迁馆协晨夫人居之。 《三元布经》云：元始天王於明霞之观，将上真玉检下授三天玉童也。 《灵书经》云：北方郁单之国有洞灵之馆，高与云齐，其处暗冥，四面无光。 别有洞灵之馆，朗然而现，四面洞彻，如日中景也。 天尊封天文於此馆中，故名之为洞灵之馆。 又云：太上道君时於南丹洞阳上馆栢陵舍中，稽首礼问元始天尊，为说《罪根上品经》也。 《灵宝隐语》云：合景北灵馆，云上携手飞。 又云：常融天有紫微之馆，处乎玉清之上，焕乎紫虚之中。 又云：过度三界之庭，升入太灵之馆也。 《太上飞行经》曰：道君逍遥羽阴之馆，息乎洞豪之门。 《八节谢罪经》云：八节之日，上皇太帝君乃登广寒上清之境，上清灵宅太空之阙，丹紫之台，长绵玉楼，群仙集于太微之观，议定天下万民之罪福也。 《道学传》云：吴猛，字世云，登山诗曰：仰瞻列仙馆，俯察玉神宅。 又云：许玉斧玄孙灵真，梁代在茅山敕为立嗣真馆，以褒远祖之德也。 陶隐居所住朱阳馆，即是许长史旧宅也。 又云：孔灵产，字彦灵，会稽山阴人也。 深研道要，遍览仙籍，宋明帝於禹穴之侧，立怀仙馆，诏使居焉。 又云：陈高祖於义仙馆发讲。 兰陵人萧子祎，字虔华，被褐起座，舍所造织成经巾，以充供养。 祎后卒，法式经书悉入公家，安国馆经巾，至今犹存也。 又云：梁世祖於天目山立太清馆，招诸道众同来憩止也。 《太洞经》云：元龟山有九灵之玉馆，太帝玉妃之所在也。 《本相经》云：高阳国中有长乐舍，方圆一丈二尺，其舍表裹悉有天景大混文字，题在四面，营卫此舍也。 《皇人守三一经》曰：峨眉山皇人以苍玉为屋，黄金为局脚状也，五色为垣也。 《登真隐诀》云：燕口山亦名方源馆，昔孝明於此合神丹而升玄洲也。 又云：古人曾合九鼎丹於此也。 《十洲记》云：瀛洲有金銮之观，饰以众瑶，直上峰云，中有青黎瑶几，覆以云执之素，刻水碧为倒龙之状，悬火精为日，刻黑玉为乌，以水精为月，请瑶为蟾兔，於地下为机捩，使昏明弦望不亏，时时有香风泠然而至，张袖受之则历纪不厌矣。 《凤台曲素上经》曰：月朗西华馆，意合广寒宫。

**Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters**

**Scripture Title:** *Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters*
Four fascicles by Wang Xuanhe of the Tang.
Source edition: *Daoist Canon of the Orthodox Unity*, Supreme Peace Section.

**Fascicle One of *Upper Clarity Daoist Ritual Matters***

**Chapter on Immortal Abodes** (also called *Daoist Precincts*, *Mystic Altars*, *Refinement Halls*, or *Jinghai*)

The *Scripture of Original Forms* states: During the Dragon Han era, the Heavenly Worthy refined the true script within the Seven Treasures Hall of the Northern Ridge’s Mystic Mound, where the celestial radiance of the Great Primordial inscribed the hall’s four sides.

The *Three Caverns Regulations* states: The establishment of *jing* halls and palace chambers follows the precept of "tranquility and governance," cultivating Heavenly Virtue. Heavenly Virtue refers to the earth of *jia*, *yi*, *bing*, and *ding*. For lay households, it is called *jing*; for masters’ abodes, it is called *zhi*. All measure one *zhang* and eight *chi* in length and one *zhang* and six *chi* in width. Those who bear the talismans and registers of the immortals and spirits must establish *jing* and *zhi*.

The *Dharma Wheel Scripture* states: Upon beholding terraces and halls, one’s thoughts become boundless, gazing universally across the eight directions. Body and spirit unite, penetrating the subtle and obscure. Now, *guan* (observation) means to gaze, to observe the eight directions. The eight directions are the eight cardinal points. If one can settle the spirit and stabilize the will, one will penetrate the wondrous and subtle, seeing clearly into the obscure and profound. The obscure and profound, the wondrous and subtle, are the ultimate fruit of the Great Profound and True Unity. Thus, the *Five Thousand Character Upper Scripture* states: "Ever desireless, one observes its mystery; ever desiring, one observes its subtlety." In the present text, the character *wei* (subtle) is mistakenly written as *hui* (emblem), a case of graphic similarity leading to a long-standing scribal error.

The *Upper Clarity Scripture of Transformations* states: The Western Terrace Hall is where the Two Perfected partake of service and where records are inscribed. It also speaks of the Nine Mysteries Hall, the Great Ultimate Abode (where the Upper Clarity’s supreme perfected undergo transformation), and the Purple Supreme Abode (wherein the secret true script of the Great Numinous is concealed).

The *Upper Clarity Scripture* states: The Harmonious Dawn Numinous Abode is where the Jade Dawn Dao Lord resides.

The *Declarations of the Perfected* states: The Hall of Shifting Changes is where the Lady of Harmonious Dawn dwells.

The *Scripture of the Three Primes’ Distribution* states: The Heavenly King of Primordial Beginning, at the Radiant Rosy Clouds Abode, commanded the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens to descend and bestow the jade tablets upon the Upper Perfected.

The *Numinous Writ Scripture* states: In the northern realm of Yüdan, there is the Cavern Numinous Hall, its height matching the clouds. Its interior is dark and lightless, its four sides devoid of illumination. Yet another Cavern Numinous Hall exists, luminous and manifest, its four sides transparent as the radiance of the sun at midday. The Heavenly Worthy sealed the celestial script within this hall, hence its name, the Cavern Numinous Hall. It also states: At times, the Supreme Dao Lord, in the Southern Cinnabar Cavern Yang’s Upper Hall of Cypress Mound, bowed in reverence to inquire of the Heavenly Worthy of Primordial Beginning, who expounded the *Upper Scripture on the Roots of Transgressions*.

The *Hidden Words of the Numinous Treasure* states: "In the Northern Numinous Hall of Conjoined Radiance, we soar hand in hand above the clouds." It also states: The Heaven of Constant Fusion possesses the Purple Tenuity Hall, situated above the Jade Clarity, resplendent within the Purple Void. It further states: "Passing through the courtyard of the Three Realms, one ascends into the Hall of the Great Numinous."

The *Scripture of the Supreme Lord’s Flight* states: The Dao Lord roams the Feathered Shade Hall, resting at the Gate of the Cavernous Vastness.

The *Scripture of the Eight Festivals’ Atonement* states: On the days of the eight solar terms, the Supreme Emperor of the August Prime ascends to the Upper Clarity’s Moonlit Cold realm, the numinous dwelling of the Great Void’s palace, the Cinnabar-Purple Terrace, the everlasting Jade Towers. The host of immortals gathers at the Great Tenuity Abode to deliberate and determine the karmic fortunes of the world’s myriad people.

The *Transmissions of Daoist Learning* states: Wu Meng, styled Shiyun, in his mountain-climbing poem, wrote: "Gazing upward at the arrayed immortals’ halls, looking down upon the jade spirits’ dwellings." It also states: Xu Yufu’s great-grandson, Lingzhen, during the Liang dynasty, was by imperial decree established at Mao Mountain’s Successive Perfected Hall to honor his distant ancestor’s virtue. Tao Hongjing’s residence, the Vermilion Yang Hall, was the former abode of the Senior Scribe Xu. It further states: Kong Lingchan, styled Yanling, a native of Shanyin in Kuaiji, delved deeply into the essentials of the Dao and perused the entire corpus of immortal texts. Emperor Ming of the Song established the Cherishing Immortals Hall beside the Yu Cavern and decreed that he reside there. It also states: Emperor Gao of Chen delivered lectures at the Righteous Immortals Hall. Xiao Ziyi of Lanling, styled Qianhua, rose from his seat clad in coarse cloth and donated his woven silk scripture scarf to serve as an offering. After Ziyi’s passing, the ritual implements and scriptures were all absorbed into the public treasury, and the scarf from the Abbey of Peace remains preserved to this day. It also states: Emperor Wu of Liang established the Great Clarity Hall on Mount Tianmu, inviting all Daoist communities to gather and rest there.

The *Great Cavern Scripture* states: On Mount Yuan Gui, there is the Nine Numinous Jade Hall, the dwelling of the Supreme Thearch’s Jade Consort.

The *Scripture of Original Forms* states: In the land of Gaoyang, there is the Hall of Eternal Joy, twelve *chi* square. Its exterior and interior are entirely inscribed with the celestial radiance of the Great Primordial script, inscribed on all four sides to protect this hall.

The *Scripture of the August Person’s Guarding the Three Ones* states: The August Person of Mount Emei constructed a house of azure jade, with legs shaped like yellow gold, and walls of five colors.

The *Concealed Instructions for Ascending Perfection* states: Yan Kou Mountain, also called the Square Source Hall, is where Emperor Xiaoming once compounded the divine elixir and ascended to the Mystic Continent. It also states: The ancients once compounded the Nine-Cauldron Elixir here.

The *Record of the Ten Continents* states: On Yingzhou, there is the Golden Turret Abode, adorned with myriad jades, its peak piercing the clouds. Within stands a dark-azure jade table, draped with a canopy of cloud-woven silk. Water-green jade is carved into inverted dragons, fire essence forms the sun, and black jade is carved into crows. Water essence forms the moon, and various jades compose the toad and hare. Beneath the ground lies a mechanism that ensures the waxing and waning of the moon remain unerring. Fragrant winds arrive cool and refreshing; to receive them with outstretched sleeves is to remain sated for ages without weariness.

The *Upper Scripture of the Phoenix Terrace and Pure Silk* states: "The moon shines upon the Western Flower Hall, its intent harmonizing with the Moonlit Cold Palace."

chunks.original_text: 婆娑紫凤下，萧条九岭峰。 流盼无穷野，仰观劫刃中。 《上皇先生紫晨经》曰：金童攀云而侍轮，玉女蹑虚而卫灵。 东游碧水之馆，洞渊浩灵，极清之源。 《登真隐诀》云：大茅山西立华阳上下二馆。 又云：方山下有宇幽馆，多有学道人居之。 又云：宋景王立馆，馆主王文清也。 《上清三天正法》云：清微馆，三天颂文出其内。 《八术神虎隐文》云：太真之馆，太微天帝君受消魔智慧神虎金符处也。 《三九素语玉精真诀》云：高上玉馆，三九素语隐在其中。 《玉帝七圣玄纪经》云：景霄观上帝君之所处。 又云：紫虚玉馆，皇人相期处。 《三道顺行经》云：紫霞内观，《八素真经》在其中。 《玉光八景经》云：玉虚之观，太上道君反寂之处。 《玉精真诀》云：高上玉馆在紫虚之天，《三九素语·玉精真诀》封在其内。 《大洞真经下》云：映天洞观，金真玉经在其中。 《大洞经下》云：道君登碧水之虚台观，沧洲之紫馆。 《三天正法》云：九玄帝君歌曰：结芒太霞馆，流盼无穷龄。 又青童君歌曰：蔼味上清馆，岂觉有余滞。 《大有妙经》云：龙吟絁宅府，凤啸太霄馆。 《大洞玉经注》云：帝君乘丹霄而启道。 太冥披绿霞而明微，焕乎金塘之馆也。 又云：金琅馆在玉清天中，上皇真人治其中。 又云：昆仑山上有九灵之馆，上接纵玑之轮，下在太室之中，西王母之所治也。 《龟山元箓》云：上游五岭峰，群翔太华观。 《七转紫晨君上经》云：上皇先生颐神神州之阙，萧条无崖之馆。 《上清八景飞经》云：太上大道君萧萧太龟之上，放浪於无崖之外，各反玉虚之馆 《真诰》云：桐栢真人歌曰：写我金庭馆，解驾三秀畿。 夜芝披华峰，咀嚼无长饥。 《真诰》云：领略三奇观，浮景绝翔冥。 又云：郁蔼非真墟，太无为我馆。 《真诰》云：紫阙构虚上，玄馆冲绝飙。 又云：翳蔼紫微馆，郁台散景飙。 又云：受精玄汉，故改容於三阴之馆。 《升玄经》云：有浮云观，天尊游行之所也。 《大洞真经》云：森朗都有中黄太一上帝之馆，始元童子在其内。 《龙飞尺素隐诀》云：太真丈人游赏紫虚之馆。 又云：蔼沫太虚馆，灵风散奇香。 又云：栢成子、谷希子、广成子、青真子，游三素八轮绮异之观也。 《白羽黑翮经》云：太真丈人盘游紫虚之馆，息驾无崖之端。 又云：太真丈人，北到朔阴洞玄之馆，寒水之乡。 《上清变化经》云：南极长生司命君，游金洞素灵之馆，遇九灵金母。 太素三元君，受龟山元箓。 又登太一上帝之馆，得《太霄琅书》。 又云：皇上度紫石於丹灵，刻录西台之馆，定礼於东华之方，合变於三素之气，仰披晨登之光。 又云：上引紫虚之气，下观混混之源，心注九玄之上馆，目罗中真之颜也。 《飞行羽经上》云：太上道君，昔游於北天，策驾广寒，足践华盖，手排九元，逸景云宫，遨戏北玄，息乎洞豪之门、羽阴之馆，盻纵玑以召运，促劫会以舞轮，叹万物，而雕丧，俯天地而长存。 《神州七转七变经》云：紫晨上皇先生怡神神州之阙，萧条无崖之馆，匡制三五之运，拯化承唐之难。 又云：明梁之馆，变白为青。 又云：豁落丹霄观，幽寥冥运彰。 又云：上晏九霄馆，萧登玉清宫。 又云：高上俨龙驾，宴景紫霄馆。

Amidst the dancing purple phoenix’s descent,
the Nine Ridges’ peaks stand desolate.
Gazing afar, the boundless wilds stretch endlessly;
looking upward, one beholds the kalpas’ edge.

The *Purple Dawn Scripture of the Supreme Sovereign Master* states:
Golden Lads ascend clouds to attend the Wheel,
Jade Maidens tread the void to guard the Divine.

Eastward lies the Azure Waters’ Hall,
the Abyssal Cavern’s numinous vastness,
the source of utmost purity.

The *Concealed Instructions on Ascending Perfection* states:
On the western side of Great Mount Mao stand the Upper and Lower Hua-Yang Halls.
It further states: Beneath Square Mountain lies the Secluded Chamber, where many Dao-seeking practitioners reside.
And: King Jing of Song established a hall, with Wang Wenqing as its master.

The *Orthodox Methods of the Three Heavens* states:
The Pure Tenuity Hall, wherein the Hymns of the Three Heavens emerged.

The *Hidden Writ of the Eight Arts and Divine Tiger* states:
The Hall of the Supreme Perfected, where the Celestial Lord of the Grand Tenuity received the Golden Talisman of the Wisdom-Endowing Divine Tiger for vanquishing demons.

The *True Formula of the Three-Nine Plain Words and Jade Essence* states:
The Lofty Jade Hall, wherein the *Three-Nine Plain Words* are concealed.

The *Seven Sages’ Mysterious Chronicle of the Jade Emperor* states:
The Scenic Radiance Abbey, where the Lord Emperor resides.
It further states: The Purple Void Jade Hall, where the August Personages convene.

The *Scripture on the Three Daoist Sequences* states:
The Purple Radiance Inner Contemplation, wherein the *Eight Plain True Scripture* resides.

The *Jade Radiance Eight Effulgences Scripture* states:
The Jade Void Abbey, where the Most High Dao Lord returns to quiescence.

The *True Formula of Jade Essence* states:
The Lofty Jade Hall lies in the Purple Void Heaven, wherein the *Three-Nine Plain Words: True Formula of Jade Essence* is sealed.

The *Lower Scripture of the Great Cavern Perfected Writ* states:
The Sky-Mirroring Cavern Abbey, wherein the Golden Perfected and Jade Scripture reside.

The *Lower Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:
The Dao Lord ascends the Azure Waters’ Void Terrace Abbey and the Azure Isle’s Purple Hall.

The *Orthodox Methods of the Three Heavens* states:
The Nine Mysteries Emperor Lord sings:
*"Weave the awn of the Great Radiance Hall,
gaze afar to boundless kalpas."*

The Azure Lad also sings:
*"The fragrant savor of the Upper Clarity Hall—
how could one sense lingering stagnation?"*

The *Scripture of Great Possession’s Wonders* states:
*"Dragons chant in the Silk Mansion,
phoenixes cry in the Grand Empyrean Hall."*

The *Commentary on the Jade Scripture of the Great Cavern* states:
The Emperor Lord rides the Cinnabar Empyrean to initiate the Dao.
The Grand Obscurity dons green radiance to illumine subtleties,
resplendent in the Golden Pond’s Hall.

It further states:
The Golden Alchemist Hall lies within the Jade Clarity Heaven, where the Supreme Sovereign Perfected governs.
And: Atop Kunlun Mountain stands the Nine Numinous Hall,
above linked to the Turning Mechanism’s Wheel,
below situated within the Grand Chamber,
where the Queen Mother of the West presides.

The *Original Register of Mount Tortoise* states:

chunks.original_text: 《玉佩金珰上经》云：太上隐玄宝章，处於玉清之馆。 又云：上清阴景内真之经，处上清之馆、太霄之中也。 《太霄紫书》云：朝游西台馆，夕憩扶桑宫。 又云：豁落紫虚馆，庆云随化消。 又云：执契太霄馆，归真玄文章。 《外国放品经》云：青童君，逍遥紫虚之馆也。 《上清投词仪》云：晏寝太常馆，峻嶒阿母庭。 《空洞灵章》云：虚明天有，梵行大馆，元正临止，司命执算。 《升玄经》云：太上於昆仑治中，进登天首大治七宝道德观，上以告张天师云：吾道出於无先太初之前。 又云：身居虎豹之薮，心在福德之观。 《洞玄经》云：紫微太灵馆，梵度天中内音书其上也。 又云：扶桑司灵馆，元洞天中内音书其上。 又云：北灵上馆，翁重天中内音书其上。 又云：北灵馆，七曜天中内音书其上。 又云：紫阳馆，文举天中内音书其上。 又云：洞灵元阳馆，在太玄都玉京山，元始、灵宝、南天大圣众至真尊神、无极大道南上赤帝、丹灵老子、太和玉女、长生司马好生君、司命司录、南极度世君、万福君，常以月二十三日会此馆，集校天人禄命长短。 《洞真经》云：金洞素灵馆，九灵金母、太素三元君所居。 又云：清微上馆，元始天王之所居。 又云：蕊珠日阙馆，太上高圣玉晨道君所居。 《道迹经》云：月上馆元始天王出皇民士叫录於其内。 《五炼生尸经》云：昔善忍国有道士晃信然，得道为元灵老君，南官书其道迹在紫微之馆也。 《内音玉字下》云：紫微馆处乎玉清之上，中有陀丘之众，驻亿万人。 陀丘者，是新得度受灵之人也。 功德未备，故停散其中。 又有太灵之馆，梵度天王治其中。

The August Ultimate Abbey stands majestic, the resplendent Jade Grove Chambers.

Yin Xi’s *Original Record of the Abbey of Lofty Contemplation* states:
In former times, King Kang of Zhou, hearing that Master Yin possessed the grand aspiration of transcendence and immortality, appointed him as a grandee and named his residence the Abbey of Lofty Contemplation. Later, King Mu of Zhou expanded this abbey, summoning reclusive worthies to become Daoists and reside within. From then on, the tradition continued unbroken to this day.

The *Sacred Records of Lord Lao* states:
King Mu of Zhou also built an abbey for Du Chong, styled Xuanyi, of Haojing, appointing Chong as a Daoist within. Later, Chong attained the rank of Perfected One of the Supreme Ultimate.

Thus it is known that the establishment of abbeys among men began with King Kang of Zhou. The placement of Daoists within abbeys, however, originated with King Mu of Zhou. As for the name "Daoist," it first arose at the time of the initial separation of Heaven and Earth. The designation of "immortal abbey" predates even the division of Heaven and Earth, existing before the Four Heavens in the Great Luo Heaven. Above the Great Luo Heaven stands the Jade Capital Mountain, home to the Abbey of the Dark Metropolis.

The *Transmissions of Daoist Learning* states:
Emperor Wen of Liu Song established the Abbey of Revering the Void for Master Lu, with Liu Faxian as its director, bestowing upon him the title of National Preceptor. Dong Shuaifa, a native of Pengcheng, was later summoned by Emperor Ming of Liu Song to serve as its director.
It further states: In the fifteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, Emperor Wu built the Abbey of the Supreme Clarity and Dark Mystery for Tao Hongjing to unify and illuminate the teachings of the Dao.
It further states: Zhang Yunzhi, a native of Jiaxing in Wu Commandery, left home in his youth to follow masters and companions. After five years, he was imperially appointed as the director of the Abbey of Revering the Origin at the Southern Cavern of Mount Mao. Later, a separate site before the abbey was established as the Abbey of Jinling, where he secluded himself from worldly affairs to cultivate the supreme Dao.

Xue Biaozhi, a native of Jinling, during the reign of Emperor Gao of Qi, went to Mount Mao to build a hut, subsisting on pine seeds and stream water for many years. When Emperor Gao of Qi sought out reclusive Daoists during his revolution, learning that Biaozhi remained steadfast in the hills and valleys, unmoved by honor or rank, he imperially appointed him as the director of the Abbey of Jinling on that mountain.

Cheng Tongsun, styled Anren, was a native of Guoshan County in Yixing. Of profound and keen disposition, he stood alone and unyielding. In his youth, he left home, maintaining a long-term vegetarian diet. Near and far, all who met him deepened their faith. In the sixteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, he was imperially appointed as the senior seat of the Abbey of Tranquil Mind, where he governed the assembly with exemplary virtue and conduct.

Meng Zhizhou, a native of Jianye in Danyang, lectured at the Abbey of Revering the Void during the Liu Song dynasty, composing the *Repentance Text of the Ten Directions*.

Xue Biaozhi, a native of Jinling, in the second year of the Jianwu era of Qi, sojourned in the eastern lands to seek out true secrets. After three years, he returned and petitioned to establish the Abbey of the Grotto Heaven on the eastern ridge of Great Mount Mao.

Jiang Fuchu, a native of Yixing, came and went from Mount Mao, aspiring to dwell there. Emperor Gao of Qi built an abbey on the mountain, and in the second year of the Jianyuan era, he was imperially summoned to perform the Daoist rites at the Abbey of Zongyang. Fuchu later established the Abbey of Assisting Perfection at the former residence of Director Xu, where he attended to the toils of reception. He then entrusted the affairs of the abbey to his second son, Hongsu, to focus solely on cultivating the supreme methods.

Dongxiang Zongchao, styled Yilun, was a native of Qianzou in Gaomi. He donated his former residence to establish the Abbey of Aspiring to the Mystery. There, he wove vines into a hut, thatched it with mallow, and together with his disciples, labored with their own hands. Though unadorned, the abbey was swiftly completed. During the reign of Emperor Jianwen of Liang, when the Prince of Luling was stationed there, he grandly constructed halls and corridors, all resplendent and magnificent, with ritual implements of exquisite refinement. Yet the master’s dwelling remained a thatched hut, his attire unchanged, his curtains of woven leaves maintaining austerity. He always sat upon a single round, worn-out couch, its surface grooved by his knees, his straw hat and rush mat frayed and unaltered.

It further states: The Daoist Zhang Fameng established the Abbey of Stone Islet on the northern bank of the Yuan Pond’s rocky islet, inviting Jia Leng to lecture there for three years. The Liang emperor commanded Yan Jizhi to reside within, where all offerings of food and ritual feasts were vegetarian. (See the *Biography of Jia Leng*.)

In the early Liu Song dynasty, Prince Jing of Changsha built a Daoist retreat east of Director Xu’s residence. In the thirteenth year of the Tianjian era of the Liang, it was imperially designated as the Abbey of Vermilion Yang. Emperor Ming of Liu Song summoned Master Lu Quan to reside at the Lodge of the Cavalry Barge, where guests and visitors were received with constant hospitality. Thus it is known that the term "retreat" is commonly used across the Three Teachings.

Yin Faren, styled Zidao, was a native of Yangxia in Chen Commandery. He left home in his youth, diligently reciting scriptures and maintaining a vegetarian diet. There was a Chen Wenhe, a wealthy man of the capital, who established the Abbey of Righteous Transcendence and invited Faren to reside there.

The Abbey of the Nine Perfected was the residence of Wang Lingyu, styled Shanbao, a native of Qu’a in Jinling, where he focused on cultivating the supreme Dao. He was imperially granted two hundred abbey laborers, along with gold, silk, incense, and medicines—all provided in abundance.

Xie Xuan, styled Yuanying, was a native of Yangxia in Chen Commandery.

Zhu Ding, styled Shu’an, was a native of Nan Sha in Xin Yi. Fond of the divine immortals, he entered Haiyu Mountain in his youth to study under Xie Xuan. Seeing his resolve, Xuan allowed him to reside at the Yuanyang Abbey, where he was tasked with safeguarding Master Zhu’s scriptures. Later, to the right of the Yuanchang Abbey, he established a separate retreat, cutting off all human traffic.

Lu Xiujing, styled Yuande, was a native of Dongqian in Wu Xing. At the foot of a waterfall on the southeast side of Mount Lu, he built an abbey named Jianji, a secluded and profound place with magnificent and extraordinary construction. Those who beheld it were filled with reverence, evoking visions of the Kunlun and Lang ranges. Later generations thus honored Xiujing with the title "Master of Simplicity and Tranquility."

Wang Sengzhen, a native of Jin Shou in Liang Zhou, established the Futang Abbey in An Lu of Pan Zhou. Passing through Ying Zhou on his return, he also built the Shenwang Abbey, both of which were exquisitely adorned. Additionally, he founded the Jiuzhen Abbey on Mount Heng. In Jing Zhou, there was the Shixing Abbey, where Yu Chengxian of Ying Zhou expounded the Daoist scriptures. Chu Boyu, styled Yuanqu, was a native of Qiantang in Wu Jun. He withdrew to the Waterfall Mountain of Mount Nan Heng, mastering esoteric arts and delving deeply into mystical diagrams and secrets. chunks.original_text: 俄而高逝，高祖追悼，乃语於瀑布山下立太平馆。 伯玉好读《太平经》，兼修其道，故为馆名也。 孙岳，字玄达，东阳永康人也。 齐永明三年，敕征为兴世馆主，遂密修至道、殷勤诱接，伏膺受业者常数百人。 又云：太守王亮、县令顾撝，永明中启台於郊，为晋陵人李景游字慧观立栖真馆，将欲缔构之夕，梦见淹成王施柱二十，助立道场，寻至城中水处，即见柟柱满水，取既满数便没。 俗言他淹成王是战国时人也。 许明业，扶风赤岗人也。 少年出家，长斋蔬食。 梁太清中为州刺史南平王请出城北神王馆供养，值乱因入武昌青溪山立馆，远近崇仰之也。 杨超，字超远，东海人。 梁时入吴包山为林屋馆主，门徒盈千人。 又为华阳馆主，於华阳之东别立招真馆焉。 冯法先，字法远，晋陵曲阿人也。 陈时茅山起崇元馆，莫不壮丽。 陈武帝初，晋陵有一僧，死得七日云：天堂有一处正构立大堂，云拟茅山冯先生。 此僧更活，欲来山中访觅，验其所见於山下见山中人出，访问知有此公，犹在世也。 张裕，天师之十二世孙，少小出家，梁天监中於虞山起招真馆居之，能致仙道也。 史袭先，字继道，吴人也。 舍妻长斋，起馆。 梁武帝嘉之，赐名曰大通玄馆也。 又有徐师子，字德威，东梅人也。 出家蔬食，陈武帝立宗虚大馆，引师子为其馆主也。 王远起，太原人也。 善礼忏，领集真馆主。 三周行道也。 淳于普洽，字法洞，吴郡人也，少出家。 市北有石名生，舍宅为馆、名为崇信，以普洽为馆主也。 张元妃，字净明，居曲阿蔡坡村，后出都造至德馆於东府城北。 梁武时也，又请以后屏迹茅山，复於南洞造玄明馆，绝谷休根，专事吐纳也。 以永定三年往海虞山，於南沙丘馆告化，还葬茅山也。 又有李令称者，庐陵女人也。 少出家离俗，入庐山，於千福乡延静里造精舍，名曰华馆。 梁元帝时人律曰安靖，治於天德。 天德者，甲乙丙丁之地也。 民家曰靖也，师家曰治也。 长一丈八尺，广一丈六尺。

Shortly thereafter, Boyu passed away, and Emperor Gaozu mourned his loss. He then ordered the establishment of the Taiping Abbey at the foot of Waterfall Mountain. Boyu had been fond of studying the *Scripture of Great Peace* and practiced its Way, hence the name of the abbey.

Sun Yue, styled Xuanda, was a native of Yongkang in Dongyang. In the third year of Yongming during the Qi Dynasty, he was summoned by imperial decree to serve as the master of Xingshi Abbey. There, he diligently cultivated the supreme Way and earnestly guided disciples, with several hundred constantly receiving his teachings.

It is also said that during the Yongming era, Prefect Wang Liang and Magistrate Gu Hui of Jinling petitioned the court to construct a terrace in the outskirts, where they established the Qizhen Abbey for Li Jingyou, styled Huiguan, a native of Jinling. On the eve of its construction, they dreamed of King Yan of Yan, who presented twenty pillars to aid in building the Daoist sanctuary. Soon after, they arrived at a body of water within the city and saw rosewood pillars filling the water—once the required number was taken, they vanished. Popular lore holds that King Yan of Yan was a figure from the Warring States period.

Xu Mingye, a native of Chigang in Fufeng, left home in his youth and maintained a strict vegetarian diet. During the Taiqing era of the Liang Dynasty, he was invited by the Prince of Nanping, the provincial governor, to reside at the Shenwang Abbey north of the city. When turmoil arose, he retreated to Mount Qingxi in Wuchang, where he established an abbey, earning reverence from both near and far.

Yang Chao, styled Chaoyuan, was a native of Donghai. During the Liang Dynasty, he entered Mount Bao in Wu to serve as the master of Linwu Abbey, where his disciples numbered in the thousands. He also served as the master of Huayang Abbey and separately established the Zhaozhen Abbey to its east.

Feng Faxian, styled Fayuan, was a native of Qu’e in Jinling. During the Chen Dynasty, the Chongyuan Abbey was built on Mount Mao, its grandeur unmatched. In the early reign of Emperor Wu of Chen, a monk from Jinling died and revived after seven days, reporting: "In heaven, a great hall is being constructed, intended for Master Feng of Mount Mao." The monk, upon reviving, sought to visit the mountain to verify his vision. When he arrived at the foot of the mountain and inquired among the locals, he confirmed that Master Feng was indeed still alive.

Zhang Yu, the twelfth-generation descendant of the Celestial Master, left home in his youth. During the Tianjian era of the Liang Dynasty, he established the Zhaozhen Abbey on Mount Yu and resided there, capable of attaining the immortal Way.

Shi Xixian, styled Jidao, was a native of Wu. He left his wife, maintained a strict vegetarian diet, and established an abbey. Emperor Wu of Liang praised him and bestowed upon it the name Datong Xuanguan.

There was also Xu Shizi, styled Dewei, a native of Dongmei. He left home and adopted a vegetarian diet. Emperor Wu of Chen established the Zongxu Da Abbey and appointed Shizi as its master.

Wang Yuanqi, a native of Taiyuan, was skilled in ritual repentance and served as the master of Jizhen Abbey, where he performed the Three Cycles of the Daoist rites.

Chunyu Puhua, styled Fadong, was a native of Wu Jun who left home in his youth. In the northern market, there was a stone named Sheng. He donated his residence to establish an abbey named Chongxin and was appointed its master.

Zhang Yuanfei, styled Jingming, resided in Caipo Village in Qu’e. Later, she traveled to the capital and constructed the Zhide Abbey north of the Eastern Prefecture’s city. During the reign of Emperor Wu of Liang, she was invited to retreat to Mount Mao, where she built the Xuanming Abbey in the southern cave. There, she abstained from grains, consumed pine roots, and devoted herself to breath cultivation. In the third year of Yongding, she journeyed to Mount Yu in Haiyu, where she announced her transformation at the Nanshaqiu Abbey before returning to be buried on Mount Mao.

There was also Li Lingcheng, a woman from Luling. In her youth, she left home and renounced worldly life, entering Mount Lu. In Yanjing Village of Qianfu Township, she built a cloister named Huaguan. During the reign of Emperor Yuan of Liang, a master of precepts named Anjing governed the abbey, which was called Tiande. Tiande referred to the land of Jia, Yi, Bing, and Ding. Among the laity, it was called *jing* (tranquility), while among the clergy, it was called *zhi* (governance). It measured eighteen feet in length and sixteen feet in width.

chunks.original_text: 凡佩仙灵符箓治职，皆须安治法座也。 上清道类事相卷之一竟 上清道类事相卷之二 楼阁品 下文仙堂中有七宝庄舍。 《洞神经》云：蓬莱山有金楼阁，高六百四十里。 《内音》云：登阤楼之上，八望三界之乡。 《大洞玉诀》云：列金门於太素丹楼。 《大洞玉经》云：太元在空洞之表，太素在幽玄之上。 九空列金门於太素之天，丹楼沓十重於太元之庭也。 《太一洞真玄经》云：飞阙天道宝殿之间，内有金房，中有太真，号曰天皇。 《玉经》云：诸受仙真玉箓者，皆登此金华之楼也。 《大洞真经》云：层楼万里，三气成烟。 玉阙虚静，丹门幽深。 金牌玉柜，符籍五篇。 又云：有帝图於紫府，刊仙名於金阁。 《洞真经》云：有太一金阁。 《七星移度经》云：北帝落死，南阙注生，东华金阙，得上我名，无穷之愿，与我齐并。 《紫度炎光经》云：骨命以定玄阁录宇，已有生名仙籍故也。 《太一金真记》引《素灵玄洞经》曰：上皇太帝君玉尊陛下，乃上登清灵，宅太虚之阙，丹城紫台，长绵玉楼，太微之观，上开九天之门，请诸九天之真、太上三老君、北极诸真乃八海大神，下命五岳名山诸得仙者，灵尊万万，并会于寥阳之殿，共集议天下万民之罪福，记诸吉凶，学道勤懈也。 《飞行羽经上序》云：阳明星上有青城玉楼，据斗真人，号曰九晨君也。 阴精星有五色玉楼，攀魁真人，号曰北上晨君也。 真人星上黄台玉楼，真人玉楼真人号曰仙华晨君处之。 玄冥星有朱台玉楼，步斗真人号玄上飞盖晨君处之。 丹元星有素台金楼，蹑纪真人号曰金刚七晨君处之。 北极星有玄台玉楼，步纲真人号曰北辰飞华君处之。 天关星有九层玉楼，乘龙真人号曰总灵九元北盖晨君处之。 辅星有紫气玉楼，游行三命真人号曰帝尊九晨君处之。 《洞神经》云：览观元化人，累劫曾息楼。 千年卧复起，毕竟无终休。 《五胜符》云：东胜之符，秘於玄瑶青林之楼，崇丘兰琼之室。 九华真妃曰：远升辰楼，飞星掷光。 《本行经》云：胄那国王有百口登楼也。 《洞玄经》云：紫微长楼在禁上，天中内音书其上。 《洞真经》 云：金华楼，仙真玉箓在其中。 《洞玄经》云：玄都长楼，皇曾天中内音书其上。 又《内音王字下》云：九层之楼，结云气而成在，太黄翁重之。 夫亦有内音在其中。 《太洞玉经· 三十九章》：太清天中有金华楼，诸受仙真玉箓者皆在此也。 《八素真经》云：玄名碧书，早刻琼阁。 又云：九宫之中，唯有太玄玉书金阁也。 又云：九宫之中，住有太玄符。 《金书玉字上经》云：骨命已定於玄阁录字，已有生名仙籍，故八素阳歌。 《九章》云：玄台结九阁，丹棑落翠精。 《道学传》云：陶弘景，字通明，魏郡人也。 明帝时栖憩锺岭隐居，更造楼，深自潜匿，以修道也。 又云：刻州长史柳悦启，割城西栖霞楼下罗含章台为国家造馆，留梁州晋寿人王僧镇为馆主也。 宋世宗明皇帝开岳以礼真命，筑馆以招幽逸，乃钻峰构宇，刊石裁基，耸桂榭於霞巘，架椒楼於烟壑，风闺伫凤，月户怀仙，求道望於海隅，简素德以居之也。 又云：王道怜，彭城女人也，志愿出家，乃入龙山货贸衣资，自造馆宇，名曰玄曜重阁，连房不日而就，壮而甚速，有若神助也。

chunks.original_text: 宝台品 《本相经第十六》云：七宝玄台，高於地上一百余丈，上下九级，周匝八面，级有一治，各有金格玉格，磬八十一枚，昼夜六时自然而唱，八十音同声而发，微而疏朗，其声和雅宛利，国土莫不闻声，一切众生皆望其音，叉手擎拳，向音而礼。 第十一云：黄玉台，神铃悬空，自然而鸣也。 《法轮经》云：若见台馆，思念无量，普瞻八极，身与我神，洞见幽微。 《玉京山经》云：岧岧天宝台，光明烂流。 《日注》 云：天宝台，九层玄台也。 《升玄第三经》 云：八面宝台，其台极高妙，种种庄严，善胜大士之所乘也。 《五胜文》云：南胜之符，秘於玄琼之台，凤林之丘，丹霄之景。 又云：驾龙飞腾於西华之台，谒拜帝真。 又云：西胜之符，秘於紫凤崇台之室。 又云：胜于晨晖，垂曜於顺北之台，谒拜帝真。 又云：北胜之符，秘於清玄兰卤琼宝之台。 又云：玄文飘飖玄治崇台。 又云：中央之符，秘於玉京之下，崇台之中。 《赤书玉诀经下》云：元始五老常以正月、三月、五月、七月、九月、十一月会於上上三天灵都宫元阳紫微之台，集算天元，推校运度。 又云：元始北天大圣，常以月八日上会灵宝玄都，北上玉山阴元台，以朝天也。 又云：元始东南天大圣，常以月十八日会灵宝太玄都玉京山洞灵丹台，以朝天文也。 又云：太玄上宫太素真人，常以春分之日会诸仙官於昆仑瑶台，校定《灵宝真经》。 又云：阳台真人，常以立冬之日会诸仙官玉女於灵宝阳台之上，校学道簿录。 《本行经》云：有寻真玉台，阎浮利国宛王为女度明之所造也。 《法轮经》云：法轮藏於太上六合台。 又云：紫兰台，琼文紫字在其中。 又云：吾开八门，偈出太上玄台也。 《众篇经》云：天尊引众真入太空金台也。 《空洞灵章》云：紫微焕七台，骞树秀玉霞。 《九天生神章》云：《生神章》秘之大有九重金格紫阳玉台。 亦见《五炼生尸经》。 《本相经第十八》云：至德上楼台，常乐无上宾。 又云：七宝紫金室，淡泊常乐台。 第十九云：紫气结治合紫气之台，金门玉户开张纳众也。 第二十经云：天运当促真文收还大罗之外玉芒玄台。 又云：习仙招魂神台，南海外阿阤加国王女名好求，学道之处。 女於此仙去，王即於其处更起集灵台、三师堂、说文室，以为广度，一千人在其中。 《金房度命上经》云：南极总司禁君，於洞虚凤京紫台，请问天尊度命之方也。 《升玄经》第六云：容预玄都台，稽首礼太无。 《内音玉字》云：九层之台，处乎玉京之山，焕乎玄都之上。 飞天常散百合之香，流五云之华。 台上有太真玉郎，一日三回十绝之旛，一周则诸天上朝，绕台三匝，诵咏洞章。 又云：馥朗天中，玉京玄台之别号，西灵真人常诵无量洞章，游行其上。 又云：升乎玉清之中，上朝紫微之台。 《八节谢罪经》云：上皇太帝君，以八节之日登于丹紫台，议定万民之罪福也。 《大洞玉经三十九章》云：德刃者，九天之台名。 又云：明真之台，亦在九天，有三日出焉。 地上之音呼明真，曰凤生也。 又云：玉清天中有绮合台，下有万津之海也。 又云：龙山者，是玉清天中高台之名，地上之音呼秀朗，为明堂也。 又云：西田之夜台，亦太帝所处，台临流汨之池，方圆百里，高仙来游，三元回驾，此台在太初天中。

**Chapter on Treasure Terraces**

The *Sūtra of Original Forms* (Chapter Sixteen) states: The Seven-Treasure Mysterious Terrace stands over one hundred *zhang* above the earth, with nine ascending levels and eight encircling faces. Each level contains a governance hall, furnished with golden and jade latticework, and eighty-one chimes that spontaneously resonate in the six daily watches. The eighty tones arise in unison, their sound subtle yet clear, harmonious and elegant, carrying so that all lands hear it. Every being gazes toward its music, clasping hands and raising fists in reverence, bowing toward the sound.

Chapter Eleven states: The Yellow Jade Terrace, with divine bells suspended in the void, rings of itself.

The *Dharma-Wheel Sūtra* states: Should one behold a terrace or pavilion, let thoughts be boundless, gazing across the eight directions. Body and spirit shall perceive the hidden and subtle as one.

The *Classic of Jade Capital Mountain* states: The towering Celestial Treasure Terrace radiates resplendent light.

The *Daily Record* states: The Celestial Treasure Terrace is a nine-tiered Mysterious Terrace.

The *Scripture of Ascending the Mysterious* (Third Scripture) states: The eight-faced Treasure Terrace is supremely lofty and wondrous, adorned in manifold splendor, the chariot of the Great Being of Excellent Virtue.

The *Text of the Five Victories* states: The talisman of the Southern Victory is concealed upon the Mysterious Jasper Terrace, the Phoenix Grove Mound, beneath the Cinnabar Auroral radiance.
It further states: Riding dragons in flight upon the Western Florescence Terrace, one pays homage to the Imperial Perfected.
It further states: The talisman of the Western Victory is concealed within the Purple Phoenix Lofty Terrace’s chamber.
It further states: Victorious in the morning glow, its brilliance descends upon the Northern Compliance Terrace, where homage is paid to the Imperial Perfected.
It further states: The talisman of the Northern Victory is concealed upon the Pure Mysterious Orchid-Salts Jasper Treasure Terrace.
It further states: The Mysterious Writ drifts upon the Lofty Terrace of Mysterious Governance.
It further states: The talisman of the Central Victory is concealed beneath the Jade Capital, within the Lofty Terrace’s midst.

The *Lower Scripture of the Red Writ and Jade Formulæ* states: The Five Elders of Primordial Beginning regularly convene in the first, third, fifth, seventh, ninth, and eleventh months upon the Terrace of Primordial Yang and Purple Tenuity within the Numinous Capital Palace of the Upper Three Heavens, where they gather to calculate celestial origins and examine the revolutions of destiny.
It further states: The Great Sage of Primordial Beginning in the Northern Heavens regularly ascends on the eighth day of each month to the Numinous Treasure Mysterious Capital, the Northern Jade Mountain’s Yin-Yuan Terrace, to pay homage to Heaven.
It further states: The Great Sage of Primordial Beginning in the Southeastern Heavens regularly convenes on the eighteenth day of each month at the Numinous Treasure Supreme Mystery Capital, the Jade Capital Mountain’s Grotto-Spirit Cinnabar Terrace, to pay homage to the Celestial Writ.
It further states: The Supreme Simplicity Perfected of the Great Mystery Upper Palace regularly gathers with the various immortal officials on the Spring Equinox at the Kunlun Jasper Terrace to collate and authenticate the *Numinous Treasure Perfect Scripture*.
It further states: The Perfected of the Yang Terrace regularly convenes with the various immortal officials and jade maidens on the day of Winter’s Advent upon the Numinous Treasure Yang Terrace to review and study the registers of the Dao.

The *Sūtra of Fundamental Conduct* states: There is a Terrace of Seeking the Perfected, built by King Wan of the Yānfúli country for his daughter, Dùmíng.

The *Dharma-Wheel Sūtra* states: The Dharma-Wheel is concealed within the Supreme Sixfold Union Terrace.
It further states: The Purple Orchid Terrace contains the jasper writ of purple characters.
It further states: I open the eight gates, and the gāthā emerges from the Supreme Mysterious Terrace.

The *Assembled Scriptures* state: The Heavenly Worthy leads the host of Perfected into the Golden Terrace of the Great Void.

The *Numinous Chapters of the Cavernous Void* state: The Purple Tenuity shines upon the seven terraces; the soaring trees flourish with jade radiance.

The *Nine Heavens’ Chapters on Engendering the Spirit* state: The *Chapters on Engendering the Spirit* are concealed within the ninefold golden latticework of the Great Existence’s Purple Yang Jade Terrace. This is also seen in the *Scripture on Refining the Corpse to Engender Life*.

The *Sūtra of Original Forms* (Chapter Eighteen) states: The Terrace of Supreme Virtue’s Upper Tower is the eternal abode of the supreme guests.
It further states: The Seven-Treasure Purple-Gold Chamber, the Serene and Joyous Terrace.

Chapter Nineteen states: The Purple Qi congeals to form the governance hall and the Terrace of Purple Qi. The golden gates and jade portals open to receive the multitudes.

The Twentieth Scripture states: When the celestial revolutions hasten, the Perfected Writ is withdrawn to the Jade Aura Mysterious Terrace beyond the Great Network.
It further states: The Terrace of the Spirit-Summoning for Immortal Practice, where the princess Hǎoqiú of the Ātíjiā kingdom beyond the Southern Sea studied the Dao. After the princess ascended as an immortal, the king erected in that place the Terrace of Assembled Spirits, the Hall of the Three Masters, and the Chamber of Scriptural Exegesis to broadly transmit the teachings, with a thousand people dwelling therein.

The *Upper Scripture on Delivering Life from the Golden Chamber* states: The Southern Culmen, Sovereign of All Prohibitions, inquired of the Heavenly Worthy upon the Purple Terrace of the Cavernous Phoenix Capital regarding the methods of delivering life.

The *Scripture of Ascending the Mysterious* (Sixth Chapter) states: Approaching the Terrace of the Mysterious Capital, one bows in reverence to the Supreme Non-Being.

The *Jade Characters of Inner Sound* state: The nine-tiered terrace stands upon the Jade Capital Mountain, resplendent above the Mysterious Capital. Flying immortals perpetually scatter the fragrance of hundredfold harmony and the blossoms of the five clouds. Upon the terrace, the Jade Youth of the Supreme Perfected thrice daily unfurls the Tenfold Absolute Banner. With each circuit, the various heavens ascend to pay homage, circumambulating the terrace thrice while reciting the Cavernous Chapters.
It further states: The Fragrant Clarity of Heaven’s midst is another name for the Jade Capital’s Mysterious Terrace, where the Western Numinous Perfected perpetually recites the boundless Cavernous Chapters, wandering above it.
It further states: Ascending amid the Jade Clarity, one pays homage to the Terrace of Purple Tenuity.

The *Scripture of Atonement on the Eight Solar Terms* states: The Supreme Emperor of the Primordial August on the eight solar terms ascends the Cinnabar Purple Terrace to deliberate and determine the karmic fortunes of all people.

The *Thirty-Nine Jade Chapters of the Great Cavern* state: *Dé Rèn* is the name of a terrace in the Nine Heavens.
It further states: The Terrace of Illuminating the Perfected also resides in the Nine Heavens, where three suns emerge. The earthly name for Illuminating the Perfected is *Fèngshēng*.
It further states: Within the Heaven of Jade Clarity stands the Brocade-Union Terrace, beneath which lies the Sea of Myriad Fordings.
It further states: *Lóngshān* is the name of a lofty terrace in the Heaven of Jade Clarity; its earthly name is *Xiùlǎng*, the Hall of Illumination.
It further states: The Night Terrace of the Western Fields is also a dwelling of the Supreme Emperor. The terrace overlooks the Flowing and Swirling Pool, a hundred *li* in circumference, where exalted immortals come to wander, and the Three Primes turn their chariots. This terrace lies within the Heaven of Supreme Beginning.

chunks.original_text: 《赤班符》云：元始天王藏九赤班符於上清斑瑶台也。 《茅君内传》云：玉清天中有散华台，是四斗七晨道君之所治也。 又云：晨中真人带迎延真符於沧浪之台。 又云：太帝君作扶桑抄会方之台也。 《后圣道君列纪》云: 后圣彭君治在灵上光台也。 《金书玉字上经》云：西玄洞台有金书，《洞房经》也。 《太元上经》云：玉景上元大虎符，在太元西瑶台也。 又云：威王之咒，藏於九天玉清之上，太元西灵之台。 《导引三光经》云：三光耀八会，落落九玄台。 又云：定光真人皇曾天绝观台中，导引元气。 又云：九变真人在玉貌天诰阳元台中，导引元气。 又云：导仙真人在何童天华林荫云台中，导引元气。 又云：云华真人在平育天玄唱宝台中，导引元气。 又云：阳玉真人在文举天回阴太真台中，导引元气。 又云：法气真人在摩夷天云结飞台中，导引元气。 又云：泽婴真人在越衡天无量极观台中，导引元气。 、 又云：流精真人在蒙翳天十绝九华台中，导引元气。 《三光八素阳歌九章》云：玄台结九阁，丹排落翠精。 《奔日月二景隐文》云：隐璘黄章，藏之丹瑶之台也。 又云：高上台，金柱玉壁，刻《郁仪结璘经》 之篇目也。 《本相经第十一》云：扶桑之地，有元始法堂，堂中有七宝经台，五部尊经苞之其内者，一曰《大洞真经》，苞之於青玉函； 二日《灵宝真经》，苞之於赤玉匮； 三曰《无量三昧经》，苞之於白玉函； 四曰《道德神真经》，苞之於黑玉匮； 五曰《本相天景经》，苞之於黄玉台。 神铃悬空，自然而鸣。 仙童玉女，手持花香宝符供养，于今不绝也。 《洞真回元九道经》云：抗辔玄羽台，飞行九玄所。 又云：空生九灵台，焕精曜太霞。 《三百观身大戒经》云：七宝流霞台，太上天尊治其中。 《起尸度亡人经》云：峨峨紫凤城，岧岧九天台也。 《道学传第十八》云：宋长沙王为东海丹徒人倪道存起淳栢经台也。 第二十卷云：传礼和北地人，汉桓帝外甥侍中传建之女也。 得道度入易迁宫中，为含真台之主也。 《列仙传》云：修羊公者，魏人也。 置石羊於通灵台上，云不知所之。 《太平经》第一百十四云：灵上光台，太师彭广渊治其中。 又云：太空琼台，太平道君处之。 《大洞真经》云：阆风玉台，总司学道仙籍也。 《七十四变化经》云：紫微台，下元八景符秘在其中。 《本行经》云：真君玉台，高百丈，浮利国宛王女度明处之。 《上清经》云：广桑山始晖庭希林台，扶桑太帝君居之。 又云：灵上光台，保皇道君居之。 六云衡山朱台，上真君居之。 《真诰经》云：方丈室昭灵，李夫人治此台也。 又云：含真台，协晨夫人居之。 《真诰经》云：白玉龟台，九灵太真元君封於此也。 《元始五老赤书玉篇真文序》曰：太空金台，天尊坐处也。 《龟山元箓下》云：元箓在南极之台也。 《本相经》云：太清玉宝台，法静真人说《元阳经》处也。 又云：天尊於东方大浮黎国中清玄玉台，说《灵宝真文》也。 又云：天尊於无量国中九合玄台，升於七宝凤机师子座上，说《本相妙经》。 又云：天尊於无量国中，紫气浩浩，合成六合紫气之台，金门玉户，开张纳众也。 又云：於清灵始老国清玉九合玄台，说《本相经》。

chunks.original_text: 《洞房经》云：无极高真徘徊九天，高会七虚，乘空洞之流軿，辔太霄之图车，出安黄房之内，入登东晨之台，游戏丹田之下，寝宴陵青之霞也。 《大洞玉经》云：欢熙於徊风之交，鸣玉於九灵之台也。 又云：龙山，是玉清天中高台名也，天帝玉字在其中也。 又云：秀朗仙台者，玉清天中仙台也，地上呼秀朗为明堂也。 《玉经》云：玉真天中有明气之光，洞照三元之台也。 又云：会方之台，太帝君之所治也。 《茅君传》云：盈命飞飙之车，诣衡山之朱台，谒太虚真人也。 又云：金台者，上真内经封其中。 《太上金简内文》曰：玄羽台者，下有采真童仰招玉晨侣。 又云：九灵台者，玉霄映北朔，琼条隐林柯，空生九灵台，焕精耀太霞。 《上清元君道经》云：朱火之台者，太极元君乘陵羽之车，鸣钟以升之。 《玉京山经》云：仰观劫仞台，俯眄紫云罗。 《上皇玉灵君道经》曰：德仞者，天之台名，地上之音呼德仞曰生华。 又云：明真之台，焕乎九霄之上，有三日出焉，地上之音呼明真曰风生也。 《上清八景飞经》云：玉宝台，三元君之所登也。 《登真隐诀》第四云：玄真白龟台，《明堂玄真经》在其中。 又云：昆仑瑶台，西王母之宫，所谓西瑶上台，天真秘文尽在其中。 《登真隐诀》云：上清之境有丹城紫台，上皇太帝君玉尊陛下集群真於其中，以定天下万民之罪福也。 七灵台在上清境，玉晨道君所居。 灵上光台在上清境，太师彭君所居。 明真台在上清境东海八停山上，太帝所居。 拂那瑶台在上清境方诸东华山上，青童君所居。 方丈台在东海方丈山，昭灵李夫人所居。 隐元台在丹龙土南阳洛山内。 又云：上清境有希林台，太帝道君居之。 又云：承华台何元字次道，晋尚书令，有阴德，得道在其中。 《真诰第五》云：东海青童君，常以丁卯日登方诸东华台，四望，向日再拜，曰出行之，可因此服日精也。 又云：峨媚台，涓子受五斗内一之法於此。 《真诰第二》云：方丈台，东宫昭灵夫人李灵飞治之也。 《真诰甄命第四》：方丈左台，昭灵李夫人诗云：飞轮高晨台，控辔玄龙隅。 《真诰》第二云：弹璈北寒台，七灵紫晖霞。 《真诰第七》云：存方台，仙人蔡天生隐其内。 又有积石台，朱孺子得道居之。 《升玄第六经》云：玉清台，仙圣上游行之所。 《真诰第十》云：封昭台，豁落符在方隅山洞间。 《上清九真中经内诀》云：太上宫高上台，有《太上玉晨郁仪奔日赤玉文》及《太上玉晨结璘奔月黄景玉章》，此二经刻以玉简，书以金字也。 《大洞雌一篇目》云：《大洞真经》秘在九天之上，大有之宫太玄灵台。 《大洞经中卷》云：晨登九景台，夕入神霄门。 又云：长寝羽台上，固神五老室。 又云：斗中真人，散华玉清之台也。 《大洞真经》云：青林千白丘有金毋台，少野童子在其中。 《七星移度经》云：帝君常居朗玄之台。 又云：帝君上登太极琼台也。 《紫度炎光经》云：太微天帝君，啸歌九玄台，崖岭凝凄端。 又云：解衿玄阆台，适我良愿会。 又云：太微天帝君受气之始，玄象初分，登九玄虚生之台。 《太真科上》云：祟玄台，天师朝礼处也。 《四极明科》云：《四极明科》封於金阙紫台也。
